title: California Small Agricultural Business Drought and Flood Relief Grant Program (CDFRG)
funder: CalOSBA (California Governor's Office of Business and Economic Development)
description: Provided relief to small agricultural businesses that experienced a decline in annual gross receipts or gross profits due to drought or storm flood conditions.
detailed_overview: The California Small Agricultural Business Drought and Flood Relief Grant Program (CDFRG) provided financial relief to small agricultural businesses that experienced a decline in annual gross receipts or gross profits due to qualifying drought or storm flood conditions. This program is currently closed.
eligibility: Small agricultural businesses that experienced a decline in annual gross receipts or gross profits due to drought or storm flood conditions.

title: Google Ad Grant
description: Google offers eligible nonprofits $10,000 per month in Google search advertising.
detailed_overview: The Google Ad Grant provides small organizations with expensive real estate on the world’s most popular website — for free! For smaller nonprofits, this is a golden ticket to increased visibility, outreach, and potential donor engagement, all without draining limited advertising budgets. The grant allows nonprofits to recruit volunteers, attract new donors, and spread their mission more effectively. Best of all, there’s no competition to get it—every eligible nonprofit can secure this funding.
eligibility: Any 501(c)(3) with a good website can qualify

title: Barney & Barney Foundation Grants
description: Funding for non-profit organizations supporting youth, the arts, the environment, societal justice, or assisting those in need.
detailed_overview: The Barney & Barney Foundation is dedicated to giving back to the community by serving those in need, supporting youth, advancing the arts, standing against societal injustice, and protecting the environment. Qualified non-profit organizations are nominated by Barney & Barney / MMA colleagues. These nominations are reviewed by the Grant Committee, and potential recipients are then invited to formally apply. Selection criteria include alignment with the Foundation's mission, the organization's financial status, and demonstrated need. Grant amounts vary based on funds raised. The Foundation also offers a $25,000 annual 'Legacy Grant' where a retired Principal selects a nonprofit recipient.
eligibility: Non-profit organizations (501(c)(3) status implied) that support the Foundation's mission (assisting those in need, supporting youth, advancing the arts, or protecting the environment). Potential recipients must first be nominated by a Barney & Barney / MMA colleague and subsequently invited to apply by the Foundation Grant Committee.
application_requirements: Nomination by a Barney & Barney / MMA colleague
Formal invitation to apply (after nomination review)
geography: Los Angeles County, California (Implicit, as listed under this county search)

title: Grants to California Early-Stage Investigators for Cancer Research
description: Grants to California early-stage investigators for cancer research projects related to diagnostics or molecular therapies.
detailed_overview: Funding is intended for oncological research studies related to diagnostics or molecular therapies. Eligible expenses include equipment, supplies, processing fees, and salary.
application_requirements: Budget plan (covering equipment, supplies, processing fees, salary)
